name: DEV - FF Luke 6 - Post Call With Fireflies Input - Andy

options.systemMessage:
You are Luke, an expert legal Business Development assistant. 
Your primary role is to support busy lawyers to complete business development and  growth actions that will increase revenue generation opportunities. You will achieve this by analysing transcripts of a short call from a lawyer post a client meeting, along with much longer form transcript and actions from the call transcript and produce a structured, professional output. 

Your Tasks: 

Identify Follow-Up Actions 

Extract all actions that arise in the transcript. 

Categorise each one clearly as: 

Agreed Action ‚Äì explicitly confirmed by lawyer or client. 

Inferred / Potential Action ‚Äì implied but not explicitly confirmed. 

Summarise the Meeting 

Provide a concise high-level summary of the main topics, issues, and next steps discussed. 

Focus on legal and practical matters, not filler conversation. 

Output Format: 

High-Level Summary 

Agreed Actions: [who is responsible, what needs doing, when if specified] 

Inferred / Potential Action: [description] 

Style & Rules: 

Be precise, neutral, and professional. Position yourself as a BD expert who is making recommendations based on a clear understanding of the optimal next course of action. 

Do not invent actions that are not supported by the transcript. 

Always separate what is confirmed from where further clarification is required. It is permitted to ask follow up questions (where required) to gain more clarity.  

Flag anything that might require clarification before being treated as a true action.

parameters.subject: =Legal Engine Actions from Client Meeting with Simmons & Simmons

Text here: {{ $json['0'] }}

categories.description:
The email has been reviewed and accepted as-is. The human explicitly or implicitly expresses approval, indicating that no changes are needed. 

Example phrases include:

"Looks good."
"Okay."
"Ok."
"Go ahead and send it."
"This works for me."
"Approved."
"No changes needed."
"Fine."
"Send."

The email has been reviewed, but the human requests modifications before it is sent like tweaks, removing parts, rewording, etc. This could include suggested edits, rewording, or major revisions. 

Example phrases include:

"Can we tweak this part?"
"Needs some changes."
"I‚Äôd like to reword this."
"Not quite right‚Äîlet‚Äôs revise it."
"Can you adjust this before sending?"
"Don't mention that we can't do that"

options.systemMessage:
=# Overview
You are an expert Business Development Executive within professional services and law. Your job is to take an incoming set of minutes, actions and next steps and revise it based on the feedback the human submitted.

## Rules
Here is the current date/time: {{ $now }}

options.systemMessage:
=Writing as a sales and business development professional, create a plain text email to the client (Simmons & Simmons) outlining the captured actions and next steps.  

The email should be drafted from the lawyer (Lara Howie) you are supporting and be addressed to the client.  

The tone should be professional but warm. You should always thanks the client for their time and make a gesture towards how useful you found the conversation. 

The content of the email should only relate to the meeting summary and the follow up actions agreed. Internal information regarding context outside of the meeting and/or actions not yet confirmed should not be included.  

Ensure it is written in UK English and NOT US English, with the names of people and Companies/Law Firms appropriately spelled and capiatlised, references to currency formatted properly, numbers and values also generally in figures as opposed to words (in keeping with UK English best practice), and with superior general spelling and grammer.  

You should keep the content as close as possible to the original and NOT add in additional information. 

INPUTS:
Client: Simmons & Simmons
Lawyer Name: Lara Howie
Lawyer Job Title: Senior Associate
Law Firm: Legal Engine Ltd

parameters.subject: =Insufficient information to create a summarry
parameters.bodyContent:
=Hi, unfortunatley there was insufficient content in our call to create a summarry.

Best regards 

Luke
Legal Engine AI Agent

summary.action_items:
**Andy Batty**
Complete building Ghost Core Luke agent with prior meeting context integration (09:07)
Strip back diary call flow and pass meeting organizer information to 11Labs agent for contextual greetings (10:32)
Share S2-S5 parent/child workflows with Eduardo for N8N access (14:01)
Coordinate with Lee on final demo requirements for Monday presentation (12:23)
Continue ChatGPT voice API evaluation when time permits (18:33)

**Eduardo Aguilar Pelaez**
Research and implement Single Sign-On solution using Microsoft credentials (15:37)
Follow up on AirTable integration status with Heather (18:03)
Continue monitoring OpenAI voice API developments for competitive analysis (19:51)

**Unassigned**
Finalize MVP requirements definition for Simmons demo (11:40)
Plan agent migration to EU infrastructure (17:29)
summary.shorthand_bullet:
üîß **Technical Progress & Workflow Development** (01:52 - 05:40)
Successfully implemented Luke to outbound call Lee workflow with on-demand triggering.
Resolved Outlook calendar credential issue where calendar selection resets when changing email credentials, requiring manual reselection from dropdown.
Completed all sub-workflow integrations using multiple set nodes as variable reset mechanisms to pass data between parent and child workflows.
Developed sequential workflow structure (S1, S2, S3) with bottom-up configuration where parent workflows know which child workflows to trigger.
Created knowledge base transmission system between multiple workflows using set nodes to capture and pass variables forward.
üõ†Ô∏è **Workflow Cloning & Architecture Challenges** (06:35 - 09:07)
Identified cloning limitations where parent workflows maintain connections to original child workflows, requiring child workflows to be cloned and renamed first.
Discovered hidden webhook connections in cloned 11Labs agents that weren't visible in the interface but continued calling Luke's webhooks.
Resolved issue by creating clean agent clone using Postman to extract exact JSON code and copying knowledge base configurations.
ü§ñ **AI Agent Development & Context Integration** (09:07 - 11:20)
Started building Ghost Core Luke agent with prior meeting context using diary call functionality.
Implemented calendar integration that filters external meeting invites and identifies most recent meetings for contextual greetings.
Planned enhancement to include meeting organizer information and external domain lookup for personalized agent interactions.
üìä **Product Development Strategy** (11:20 - 12:23)
Clarified MVP requirements for Simmons demo with three tiers: MVP, MVP Plus, and higher levels requiring resource and time assessment.
Emphasized need for reusable component development and prioritization based on biggest impact potential.
üîí **Technical Challenges & Access Issues** (13:24 - 16:20)
Single Sign-On (SSO) integration remains unsolved for using Microsoft credentials throughout entire workflow.
N8N access permissions need resolution - Eduardo missing S2-S5 parent/child workflows despite having S1 and other Luke-related workflows.
Current workaround involves hard-coding credentials or creating individual agents per person.
üåç **11Labs Implementation & Infrastructure** (16:36 - 17:45)
Achieved rapid internal adoption with 5-minute agent deployment impressing internal teams.
Confirmed EU domain compliance with delivery instance showing EU flag and domain structure.
Identified need for agent migration to EU infrastructure as discussed previously.
üîó **Integration Status & Future Considerations** (17:46 - 20:02)
AirTable integration pending with no response from Heather yet.
ChatGPT Voice API evaluation shows usability challenges requiring more coding but provides business risk mitigation against 11Labs pricing changes.
OpenAI voice model offers multi-agent handoff capabilities and competitive de-risking with 50% probability of widespread voice integration across major websites within six months.
Identified competitive threat where direct diary API integration could replicate current functionality.
summary.overview:
- Successfully implemented the outbound call workflow from Luke to Lee, enabling on-demand triggering for enhanced functionality.
- Resolved the Outlook calendar credential issue, which previously required manual reselection due to credential changes.
- Completed all sub-workflow integrations, establishing variable reset mechanisms to efficiently pass data between parent and child workflows.
- Developed a sequential workflow structure with parent-child functionality for streamlined execution of multiple workflows.
- Identified cloning limitations where parent workflows retain original connections, necessitating cloning and renaming of child workflows first.
- Resolved hidden webhook connections in cloned 11Labs agents by extracting JSON via Postman to ensure clean migrations.
- Initiated the development of the Ghost Core Luke agent, incorporating prior meeting context for enhanced personalization.
- Clarified MVP requirements for Simmons demo, establishing tiered levels while emphasizing reusable component development for maximum impact.
- Encountered ongoing challenges with Single Sign-On integration for Microsoft credentials and N8N access permissions for certain workflows.
- Achieved rapid internal adoption of agent deployment in 5 minutes and confirmed EU compliance with delivery instances.
summary.bullet_gist:
üìû Outbound Call Workflow: Successfully implemented a new outbound call workflow to enhance functionality.
üîë Credential Issues Resolved: Fixed Outlook calendar credential problems, eliminating manual reselection.
üîÑ Sub-Workflow Integrations: Completed integrations with mechanisms for efficient data transfer.
‚öôÔ∏è Sequential Workflow Structure: Developed a new structure for streamlined execution of workflows.
‚úÖ Rapid Deployment: Achieved internal adoption of agent deployment in just 5 minutes.
summary.gist: The meeting focused on workflow improvements, integration issues, and agent development for enhanced functionality and compliance.
summary.short_summary: Significant progress was made in implementing an outbound call workflow from Luke to Lee, which allows for on-demand triggering to enhance functionality. The team resolved the Outlook calendar credential issue that required manual reselection, and completed all sub-workflow integrations, establishing efficient variable reset mechanisms for data transfer between workflows. A sequential workflow structure with parent-child functionality was developed for streamlined execution. Challenges with cloning limitations were identified, requiring the renaming of child workflows to retain connections. Hidden webhook connections in cloned 11Labs agents were resolved, and the development of the Ghost Core Luke agent was initiated for improved personalization. MVP requirements for the Simmons demo were clarified to emphasize reusable components, while ongoing challenges with Single Sign-On integration and access permissions were noted. Notably, the internal agent deployment achieved rapid adoption within 5 minutes and confirmed compliance with EU regulations.

transcript.message: Hey, how was your meeting with Simmons & Simmons LLP Lara? Ready for a quick debrief?

Great. Let's capture the key points from your meeting. I'll ask three quick questions.

First, is there any additional context you want to capture now that the client isn‚Äôt around?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Ready for a quick debrief on the meeting with Simmons & Simmons LLP?
Did you capture any additional context during the meeting with Simmons & Simmons LLP?

transcript.message: No problem. Is there anything else you'd like to add to the context?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What additional context would you like to capture from the meeting with Simmons & Simmons LLP?

transcript.message: Yeah, so it's a good meeting and first time we've met them. So Jo is obviously the boss, but she delegates a load of responsibility to both Connor and Julia. Connor's going to be our kind of day-to-day go-to person for actions, etc.,
Okay, so Jo is the main contact, but Connor and Julia are delegated key responsibilities. Connor will be our main point of contact for day-to-day actions. Is that right?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What is the structure of the team at Simmons & Simmons LLP and who is the main point of contact for day-to-day actions?

transcript.message: What are the immediate next steps and when is the next touch point or meeting?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Is Jo the main contact and Connor the main point of contact for day-to-day actions?

transcript.message: So we're going to set up daily calls at 8 o'clock and 5 o'clock so that we can update the team as this situation resolves itself. So we've taken an action that we will set those calls up. As far as other actions, Joe is going to draft a detailed timeline of all of the activities which occurred immediately post acknowledgement that the breach had occurred. Julia is going to draft some customer comms and a framework for those comms going forward. We are then going to review those comms from Julia, and we're going to do that overnight tonight because we want to get the first customer comms out by 8 o'clock in the morning.
Can you clarify who is responsible for setting up the daily calls?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What are the immediate next steps and when is the next touch point or meeting?

transcript.message:
Okay, so the immediate next steps are: daily calls at eight and five to update the team, Jo to draft a timeline of post-breach activities, Julia to draft customer communications and a framework for future comms, and the Legal Engine team to review those comms overnight for an eight a.m. customer release.

Is there anyone internally we should introduce the client to?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Who sets up the daily calls?

transcript.message: Yeah, we're going to bring Sam on to the call tomorrow morning at the stand-up call because he's got a bit of experience in data breaches, so it'd be good to have him as part of the team and we'll introduce him to Joe, Conor and Julia.
Okay, I'll send you over a summary via email now, please allow a few minutes for it to land in your inbox.

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Should we introduce Sam to Joe, Conor, and Julia tomorrow morning at the stand-up call?

transcript.message: Happy to help! Have a great day.

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Should we introduce Sam to the client tomorrow morning at the stand-up call?

analysis.transcript_summary: Lara debriefed with the agent about a meeting with Simmons & Simmons LLP. Key points: Jo is the main contact, Connor is the day-to-day contact. Next steps include setting up daily calls at 8 AM and 5 PM, Jo drafting a timeline, and Julia drafting customer comms for review. Sam will be introduced to the client team tomorrow due to his data breach experience. The agent will send a summary email.
